item.title: 欧佩克+在决定七月产量之前召开配额审查会议
item.description: 欧佩克+"将于周三举行在线会议，审查今明两年的产量配额，然后由八个主要成员国在周末决定是否在七月份再次提高产量。【原文：OPEC+ will gather online on Wednesday to review production quotas for this year and next, before eight key members decide at the weekend whether to bolster output again in July.】

item.title: 法国 4 月消费者支出增幅低于预期
item.description: 在年初家庭需求疲软拖累经济增长之后，法国 4 月份消费者支出增幅低于预期，回升乏力。【原文：French consumer spending rose less than expected in April in a tepid pick-up after weak household demand weighed on economic growth at the start of the year.】

item.title: 老虎品牌计划派发特别股息，因利润增长而提高派息率
item.description: 南非最大的上市食品生产商老虎品牌有限公司（Tiger Brands Ltd.）在利润攀升 34% 后，提高了中期股息，并表示还将支付特别股息。【原文：Tiger Brands Ltd., South Africa’s biggest listed food producer, lifted its interim dividend and said it would also pay a special dividend after profit climbed 34%.】

item.title: 如果李在镕赢得选举，韩国将进一步平衡中美关系
item.description: 如果中间偏左的候选人在韩国总统大选中获胜，这将预示着首尔在中美竞争中将更加谨慎，并将做出新的努力来吸引朝鲜参与对话，同时也预示着与日本关系紧张的可能性。【原文：A win for the left-of-center frontrunner in South Korea’s presidential election would likely herald more caution by Seoul over taking sides in US-China rivalry, a new effort to draw North Korea into dialogue and the potential for tension with Japan.】

item.title: 道尔顿与与村上有联系的基金结盟，撼动富士媒体
item.description: 道尔顿投资公司（Dalton Investments）正联合其他投资者向富士媒体控股公司（Fuji Media Holdings Inc.【原文：Dalton Investments is joining forces with other investors to pressure Fuji Media Holdings Inc. to spin off its real estate arm, the latest development in what’s become a litmus test for shareholder influence in Japan.】

item.title: 迪拜酋长的 5.84 亿美元房地产投资信托首次公开募股首次亮相即大涨
item.description: 迪拜控股公司（Dubai Holding）价值 5.84 亿美元的住宅房地产投资信托基金在首次交易中大涨，因为迪拜房地产市场的繁荣继续吸引着投资者。【原文：Dubai Holding’s $584 million residential real estate investment trust surged in its trading debut, as the city’s property market boom continues to lure investors.】

item.title: 中国回应世界银行计划开设新加坡和香港办事处
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亚洲基础设施投资银行正寻求在香港和新加坡开设新的办事处，这一计划将标志着该银行自近十年前在北京开始运营以来的最大一次扩张。【原文：The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank is looking to open new offices in Hong Kong and Singapore, according to people familiar with the matter, in a plan that would mark its biggest expansion since beginning operations in Beijing almost a decade ago.】

item.title: 马来西亚经济部长拉菲齐将于 6 月 17 日辞职
item.description: 马来西亚经济部长拉菲齐-拉姆利（Rafizi Ramli）表示，他将从 6 月 17 日起辞去内阁职务，这距离他在执政党内部选举中落败还不到一周时间。【原文：Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli said he is resigning from the cabinet effective June 17, less than a week after he was defeated in the ruling party’s internal election.】

item.title: 投资者为何担心日本债券市场
item.description: 全球债券市场的不安情绪正在蔓延到日本，几十年来，日本市场几乎没有任何波动；这让已经被美国国债摩擦吓坏了的投资者感到担忧。【原文：Global bond jitters are spilling into Japan, a corner of the market that for decades experienced barely any volatility — and it’s worrying investors already spooked by frictions in US Treasuries.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英镑跌破 1.35 美元，英国股市将巩固涨势
汇率波动后台湾考虑放宽对保险公司的规定
item.description: 台湾的保险公司正面临着关于近期本币波动所造成的损失的难题。监管机构可能有部分解决方案：让公司改变计算外币资产价值的方式。【原文：Taiwanese insurers are facing difficult questions about the damage of recent swings in the local currency. Regulators may have a partial solution: letting firms change how they calculate the value of foreign currency assets.】

item.title: 拉古拉姆-拉詹警告美国遏制外国留学生会给未来带来风险
item.description: 印度储备银行前行长拉古拉姆-拉詹警告说，如果政治侵蚀了向美国大学输送留学生的渠道，美国经济将面临长期风险。【原文：Former Reserve Bank of India Governor Raghuram Rajan warned about the long-term risks to the US economy if politics eroded the pipeline of international students to American universities.】

item.title: 法拉奇在针对工党的英国福利计划中模糊财政状况
item.description: 奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）通过呼吁扩大福利支付和减税，明确试图赢得工党核心工人阶级选民的支持。但不那么明确的是：这位改革英国领导人将如何在不破坏英国预算的情况下支付这些费用。【原文：Nigel Farage made a clear attempt to win over Labour’s core working-class voters by calling for expanding welfare payments and cutting taxes. What was far less clear: How the Reform UK leader would pay for it without busting Britain’s budget.】

item.title: 认识竞争非洲开发银行领导人的五位人士
item.description: 非洲大陆最大的本土多边贷款机构非洲开发银行将于本周四选出新的领导人。【原文：The African Development Bank, the continent’s largest home-grown multilateral lender, will elect its new leader on Thursday.】

item.title: 网络攻击激增为保险公司带来机遇，促使其反思保费问题
item.description: 近期备受瞩目的网络攻击事件激增，为慕尼黑再保险公司（Munich Re AG）和丘博保险公司（Chubb Ltd.）等保险公司提供了从迅速扩大的市场中套现的机会，同时也引发了对保费的重新思考。【原文：A recent surge in high-profile cyberattacks is offering an opportunity for insurers including Munich Re AG and Chubb Ltd. to cash in from a rapidly expanding market — and prompting a rethink on premiums.】

item.title: 皇家恩菲尔德制造商提前从印度出货躲过美国关税
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度标志性摩托车制造商皇家恩菲尔德公司在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普针对汽车进口之前，就将对美国的出口前置，希望保持价格稳定，赢得寻求经济实惠摩托车的客户。【原文：The Indian maker of the iconic Royal Enfield motorcycles frontloaded exports to the US before President Donald Trump targeted automobile imports, hoping to keep prices stable and winning customers seeking affordable rides, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 螺纹钢价格跌至八年新低，中国钢铁业困境加剧
item.description: 中国建筑业使用的一种关键钢材价格创下了自 2017 年以来的最低点，因为这个全球最大的金属市场正面临着大量钢材供应过剩的问题。【原文：Prices of a key Chinese steel product used in construction were at their lowest since 2017 as the world’s biggest market for the metal grappled with a massive glut.】

item.title: 日本 40 年期债券销售需求为 7 月以来最弱
item.description: 日本周三拍卖 40 年期国债时遇到了自 7 月份以来最弱的需求，这一结果有可能加剧全球债务市场的进一步波动。【原文：Japan’s auction of 40-year government bonds Wednesday met demand that was the weakest since July, an outcome that risks fueling further volatility in global debt markets.】

item.title: 美国为雪佛龙公司继续在委内瑞拉开展业务颁发有限许可
item.description: 特朗普政府向雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.）颁发了留在委内瑞拉的简易许可证，允许该公司对设备进行最低限度的维护，但禁止其在这个受制裁的南美国家生产石油。【原文：The Trump administration issued a stripped-down license to Chevron Corp. to remain in Venezuela, allowing the company to conduct minimal maintenance on equipment but prohibiting it from producing oil in the sanctioned South American nation.】

item.title: 日本支持人工智能芯片初创公司 EdgeCortix 推动国防科技发展
item.description: 总部位于东京的人工智能芯片初创公司 EdgeCortix Inc.【原文：EdgeCortix Inc., a Tokyo-based AI chip startup, is riding a wave of interest to foster Japanese semiconductors with defense applications.】

item.title: 俄罗斯对印度原油贸易中出现受美国制裁的油轮
item.description: 在将俄罗斯石油运往印度的复杂海上供应链中，出现了受美国制裁的油轮，就在进口量创下历史新高之际，这引起了人们对这个亚洲国家对石油流动态度的质疑。【原文：US-sanctioned tankers have emerged in the complex maritime supply chain that ferries Russian oil to India, raising questions about the Asian nation’s stance toward the flows just as imports hit a record.】

item.title: 巴西就电动车巨头比亚迪工厂的 "奴役 "条件提起诉讼
item.description: 巴西劳工检察官正在起诉中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪股份有限公司（BYD Co.【原文：Brazilian labor prosecutors are suing Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD Co. and two contractors over allegations of slave labor and human trafficking at the construction site of a manufacuturing plant.】

item.title: 印度股市牛市寄望六月持续上涨
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 香港要求养老金制定计划以防美国评级调整
item.description: 香港官员要求香港的养老基金制定适当的策略，以应对美国政府债务信用评级方面的 "任何重大市场事件"。【原文：Hong Kong officials told the city’s pension funds to formulate appropriate strategies in the event of “any significant market events” regarding the credit rating of the US government debt.】

item.title: 上田誓言关注长期收益率飙升带来的波纹效应风险
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）誓言要监控超长期债券收益率上升可能对期限较短的债务产生的影响，在政府表示有意解决日益严重的市场困境的前一天，上田一夫暗示了对这一问题的担忧。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda vowed to monitor the impact that rising yields on super long bonds may have on debt with a shorter maturity, hinting at concern a day after the government signaled its intention to address growing market distress.】

item.title: 大洋控股收到 KKR 等公司的收购建议书
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本化学品制造商大洋控股公司已收到两家公司的收购建议，其中包括美国投资公司 KKR & Co.。【原文：Japanese chemical manufacturer Taiyo Holdings Co. has received acquisition proposals from two companies including US investment firm KKR & Co., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新西兰第六次降息推动经济复苏
item.description: 新西兰央行连续第六次降息，并表示仍有进一步降息的空间，以促进受美国关税影响的经济复苏。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank cut interest rates for a sixth straight meeting and signaled it has scope for further reductions to bolster an economic recovery that’s been clouded by US tariffs.】

item.title: 贸易停战后经济学家对中国通货紧缩的担忧加深
item.description: 经济学家预计，中国的通货紧缩压力将进一步加剧，尽管在与美国的贸易战休战之后，他们提高了对今年经济增长和出口的预测。【原文：Economists expect deflationary pressure to get worse in China, even as they improve forecasts for growth and exports this year after a truce in the trade war with the US.】

item.title: 澳大利亚月度 CPI 高于预期，澳元走高
item.description: 澳大利亚 4 月份的月度通胀率略高于预期，与此同时，关税动荡扰乱了市场，促使储备银行上周降低了利率。【原文：A gauge of Australia’s monthly inflation came in slightly faster than expected in April, coinciding with a period of tariff turmoil that roiled markets and encouraged the Reserve Bank to lower interest rates last week.】

item.title: 中行吹捧华尔街实习生存款 100 万美元
item.description: 在利率下行的背景下，中国各家银行都在争夺存款，其中一家贷款机构采取了一种新颖的方式来赢得业务：它为存款超过 100 万美元的家庭提供帮助，确保他们在美国一些最大的公司以及华尔街银行实习。【原文：As Chinese banks battle for deposits amid sinking interest rates, one lender, briefly, took a novel approach to win business: It offered help in securing internships at some of the nation’s biggest companies as well as Wall Street banks for families who put in more than $1 million.】
